author: bmanikm
body:
X86 PS Console

``` powershell
PS C:\Windows\system32> $env:PSModulePath
C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Users\manikb\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Program Files (x86)\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules
PS C:\Windows\system32> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14369.1000
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14369.1000
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

I think, it should be

``` powershell
C:\Users\manikb\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Program Files (x86)\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules
```

x64 PS Console

``` powershell
PS C:\Windows\system32> $env:PSModulePath
C:\Users\manikb\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules;C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: No plan to support wow64 on PSCore

title: Need to change the order of module paths in $env:PSModulePath in WOW64 PS Console
